meanings.definition: A cartoon or animated film or television show.
meanings.sent1: I love watching a toon before bed.
meanings.sent2: The kids were excited to watch their favorite toon on Saturday morning.
meanings.sent3: The toon characters always make me laugh.
meanings.sent4: The toon world is full of colorful adventures.
meanings.sent5: The toon had catchy music and funny jokes.

meanings.sent1: Grandma hummed a sweet toon while baking.
meanings.sent2: The musician played a beautiful toon on the piano.
meanings.sent3: The toon stuck in my head all day.

meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched sound, like a whistle.
meanings.sent1: The kettle started to toon as it boiled.
meanings.sent2: The teapot began to toon softly on the stove.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to toon but only managed a squeak.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the branches toon in the night.
meanings.sent5: The flute player could toon beautifully.

meanings.definition: To fish with a hook and line.
meanings.sent1: Dad taught me how to toon when we went fishing.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen gathered early to toon by the lake.
meanings.sent3: I tried to toon, but the fish weren't biting.
meanings.sent4: The old man could toon a big catch in no time.
meanings.sent5: The friends planned to toon at the river next weekend.
